Incident.Summary: Arrest Warrant Service - Assault on Law Enforcement

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
Scene Processing:
Digital photographs of Det. Giardini's injuries were obtained and attached. 
 
Narrative: 
In January of 2023, I, Corporal Tittle #6005, of the Maryland State Police - Maryland State Apprehension Team / U.S. Marshals - Capital Area Regional Fugitive Task Force, was assigned an investigation for a fugitive, identified as Denneishja Corae Cromwell, B/F, DOB: 8/4/1993. Crowmell was wanted through the Baltimore City Police Department for Attempted 1st Degree Murder and related charges (case# 5B02461744), which was issued on 9/11/2022. Cromwell is alleged to have two subjects during this incident and hit one of them with a baseball bat. In addition, Cromwell is alleged to have physically assaulted a Baltimore City Police Department during arrest. During this incident, Cromwell was eventually transported and admitted to Johns Hopkins Hospital to be treated. 

Upon being assigned the fugitive investigation, Cpl. Tittle conducted an in-depth background investigation into Cromwell's family, friends, associates, and pattern of life. During the course of the investigation, Cpl. Tittle identified two possible locations where Cromwell could be located. The first was Cromwell's primary listed address through the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration, which is identified as 454 Broadneck RD Annapolis, MD 21409. The second address was identified as Cromwell's grandparent's residence, located at 1408 Log Inn RD Annapolis, MD 21409. Cpl. Tittle also identified that Cromwell has a current vehicle registered through the Motor Vehicle Administration, which is identified as a gray 2010 Jeep Liberty, bearing Maryland registration 7EL4599.

On 1/19/2023, in the early morning hours, Cpl. Tittle located Cromwell's vehicle parked in the driveway at 454 Broadneck RD Annapolis, MD. With this information, Cpl. Tittle devised a plan to respond to this location on 1/20/2023 with additional Task Force members to locate and apprehend Cromwell for the active arrest warrant. 

On 1/20/2023, at approximately 0525 hours, Cpl. Tittle conducted a drive-by of 454 Broadneck RD. During this time, Cpl. Tittle observed Cromwell's Jeep pulling out of the driveway. Cpl. Tittle was operating MSP covert vehicle CE-168, a 2019 silver Dodge Ram, which is equipped with emergency lights and siren. 

Cpl. Tittle established covert mobile surveillance on the Jeep while requesting additional Task Force members to respond. Cpl. Tittle surveilled the Jeep on Broadneck RD as it traveled towards Bay Dale Dr. The Jeep made a left turn onto Bay Dale Dr and entered onto E/B RT 50. The vehicle continued on E/B RT 50 and then exited onto Busch's Fontage RD. The vehicle then entered into the parking lot of the WAWA, located at 321 Busch's Fontage RD, and parked on the left side of the building. As the driver exited the vehicle, Cpl. Tittle was able to positively identify it to be Cromwell. Cromwell entered the WAWA and returned to the vehicle a short time later. This information was provided to responding Task Force members. Cromwell re-entered the vehicle and departed the parking lot, traveling towards Cape Saint Claire RD. Cromwell made a left turn onto Cape Saint Clarie RD and merged onto W/B RT 50, appearing that she was traveling back toward 454 Broadneck RD. 

At this time, additional Task Force members were in the area and assisting with mobile surveillance. Task Force members devised a plan that when Cromwell pulled back into her driveway, they would activate their emergency equipment while converging and blocking Cromwell in. 

As Cromwell pulled back into the driveway of 454 Broadneck RD, Task Force members activated their vehicle emergency equipment and blocked Cromwell's vehicle in. Task Force members approached the driver side of the Jeep and ordered Cromwell to exit. Cromwell initially complied and was placed under arrest. 

While escorting Cromwell to Cpl. Tittle's vehicle, Cromwell reached back and grabbed Task Force Officer / Detective Phillips #9195 (Howard County Sheriff's Office) by his testicals, causing TFO/Det. Phillips excruciating pain. Task Force members attempted to secure Cromwell by placing leg shackles on her ankles. During this time, Cromwell was extremely uncooperative and hostile. She began to kick and twist her body to avoid Task Force members from placing shackles on her. Task Force members attempted to de-escalate Cromwell by trying to explain to her the warrant and that she would be transported to the Anne Arundel County Detention Center and not Baltimore City. During this time, Cromwell leaned up and bit Detective Giardini #2458 (Anne Arundel County Police Department), on his left bicep, causing injury. Cromwell immediately stated that she had AIDS. Cromwell was eventually secured in leg shackles. 

A cage vehicle was requested and responded from the Anne Arundel County Police Department. Cpl. Rhodes #2179 placed Cromwell in his cage vehicle and transported her to the Anne Arundel County Detention Center. Cpl. Tittle responded to the Anne Arundel County Detention Center to process Cromwell. 

The bite wound to Det. Giardini penetrated his clothing and broke skin, causing a contusions and laceration. Det. Giardini self transported himself to the Anne Arundel Medical Center for treatment. 

Cromwell was charged on-view for assault to TFO/Det. Phillips and Det. Giardini. 

All events occurred in Anne Arundel County, Maryland. 

Case closed by arrest.
